source: Am2901 Four-Bit Bipolar Microprocessor Slice datasheet, AMD 1975
notes: 4-bit ALU bit-slice processor. All operations execute in a single microinstruction cycle. The Am2901 has 16 ALU function codes selected by I5-I3, with source operand selection via I2-I0 (8 source combinations) and destination/shift via I8-I6 (8 destination combinations). Cycle counts represent single microinstruction execution times. The 3-bit ALU function select (I5-I3) determines the core operation.

instructions.notes: R plus S. Function code I5-I3=000. Single-cycle ALU add
S minus R. Function code I5-I3=001. Reverse subtract
R minus S. Function code I5-I3=010. Forward subtract
R OR S. Function code I5-I3=011. Logical OR
R AND S. Function code I5-I3=100. Logical AND
NOT(R) AND S. Function code I5-I3=101. Inverted R masked with S
R XOR S. Function code I5-I3=110. Exclusive OR
R XNOR S. Function code I5-I3=111. Exclusive NOR (equivalence)
Source select I2-I0=000: R=A, S=Q. Selects A register and Q register as ALU operands
Source select I2-I0=001: R=A, S=B. Selects A and B registers as ALU operands
Source select I2-I0=010: R=0, S=Q. Zero and Q register
Source select I2-I0=011: R=0, S=B. Zero and B register
Source select I2-I0=100: R=0, S=A. Zero and A register
Source select I2-I0=101: R=D, S=A. External data and A register
Source select I2-I0=110: R=D, S=Q. External data and Q register
Source select I2-I0=111: R=D, S=0. External data and zero
